Although significant amounts of aldehydic LOPs also arise from MUFAs, these were only generated at prolonged heating times, i.e. significant lag phases preceded their evolution (Figs 1, 2 and S2, and Table 1). Moreover, only two major classes of aldehydes are produced from the fragmentation of MUFA-derived HPMs (specifically n-alkanals and trans-2-alkenals, the former of which are arguably of a lower toxicity than the latter), whereas a much broader pattern of these agents are produced from PUFA-derived CHPDs (including trans,trans-alka-2,4-dienals, for example)
8, 9 . Intriguingly, the total unsaturated aldehyde concentration determined in PUFA-rich sunflower oil heated for a period of 90 min. according to our LSSFEs was very close to or exceeded a staggeringly high figure of 0.05 mol.kg −1.
